criteria: Understanding of Weathering and Erosion Processes
Identification of Cause and Effect Relationships
descriptions: No observations or measurements are recorded.
Limited observations or measurements are recorded with no clear connection to weathering or erosion.
Basic observations and measurements are recorded, but the evidence of weathering or erosion is unclear or incomplete.
Adequate observations and measurements are recorded, providing some evidence of weathering or erosion. The data may lack precision or detail.
Detailed and relevant observations and measurements are recorded, providing clear evidence of the effects of weathering or the rate of erosion. Data is mostly accurate and sufficiently detailed.

Comprehensive and precise observations and measurements are recorded, providing strong and convincing evidence of the effects of weathering or the rate of erosion. Data is accurate, detailed, and well-organized.
Demonstrates no understanding of weathering or erosion processes.
Demonstrates a minimal understanding of weathering or erosion processes with significant misconceptions.
Demonstrates a basic understanding of weathering and erosion processes, but struggles to connect observations to the underlying science.
Demonstrates a satisfactory understanding of weathering and erosion processes and can make connections to observations with some guidance.
Demonstrates a strong understanding of weathering and erosion processes, explaining the connections to observations clearly and accurately.

Demonstrates a comprehensive understanding of weathering and erosion processes, explaining the connections to observations with depth and insight. Can articulate multiple factors influencing the rates.
Fails to identify any cause and effect relationships related to weathering or erosion.
Identifies cause and effect relationships incorrectly or with significant inaccuracies.
Identifies basic cause and effect relationships, but explanations are superficial or incomplete.
Identifies several cause and effect relationships, providing adequate explanations supported by observations and/or measurements.
Clearly and accurately identifies key cause and effect relationships, providing strong explanations supported by observations and/or measurements.
Insightfully identifies complex cause and effect relationships, providing thorough and nuanced explanations supported by comprehensive observations and/or measurements.
No scientific practices are evident.
Attempts to use scientific practices are unsuccessful or inappropriate.
Uses some scientific practices, but implementation is flawed or incomplete.
Uses appropriate scientific practices to collect and analyze data, with some minor errors or omissions.
Effectively uses appropriate scientific practices to collect and analyze data, demonstrating a good understanding of the scientific method.
Demonstrates mastery of scientific practices, designing and executing a rigorous investigation to collect and analyze data with precision and accuracy.
